question.text: Which of the following events take place during post-transcriptional modification in eukaryotes?

options.text: Exons are removed from primary transcript.
7-methyl guanosine cap is added at 3' end of RNA transcript
Addition of poly A segmant at 5' end of trnascript.
In tailing, adenylated residues are added in a template independent manner.

solution.text: The second complexity is that the primary transcripts contain both the exons and the introns and are non-functional. Hence, it is subjected to a process called splicing where the introns are removed and exons are joined in a defined order. hnRNA undergoes additional processing called as capping and tailing. In capping an unusual nucleotide (methyl guanosine triphosphate) is added to the 5'-end of hnRNA. In tailing, adenylate residues (200-300) are added at 3'-end in a template independent manner. It is the fully processed hnRNA, now called mRNA, that is transported out of the nucleus for translation.
